data.title: Encryption Enigma
data.solution:
n = int(input())
message = input()
x = len(message)
while x>26:x-=26
encryptions = [message]
for i in range(n):
  y = ""
  for j in message:
    if j.isalpha():
      tempX = x
      num = 0
      overZ = False
      while (ord(j)+tempX>ord('z')):
        tempX-=1
        num+=1
        overZ = True
      if overZ:
        y+=chr(96+num)
      else:
        y+=chr(ord(j)+tempX)
    else:
      y+=j
  encryptions.append(y)
  message = y
print(encryptions[len(encryptions)-1])
data.statement:
Your program must take the int [[n]] and the string [[message]] and encrypt it as follows:
In the style of the Caesar Cipher, you must shift every letter in the message right (a -> b, f -> g, etc) by the length of the string. [[message]] can contain non-alphanumeric characters; leave those as they are. Additionally, you must encrypt [[message]] [[n]] times. Each time you encrypt it, [[message]] must become the encrypted message, so that the message is compounded encrypted [[n]] times.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your program must take the int n and the string message and encrypt it as follows:
In the style of the Caesar Cipher, you must shift every letter in the message right (a -> b, f -> g, etc) by the length of the string. message can contain non-alphanumeric characters; leave those as they are. Additionally, you must encrypt message n times. Each time you encrypt it, message must become the encrypted message, so that the message is compounded encrypted n times.
Input
Line 1: an integer n
Line 2: a string message
Output
A single line, the string message encrypted as explained in the statement.
Constraints
0 <= n <= 100
message can contain any ASCII character, but alphabetical characters will always be in lowercase.
Example
Input
1
hello
Output
mjqqt
